result.title: Is there a way to compile with g++ so that it creates a copy of the .cpp file in some place?
result.content: I use ST3 to build my cpp programs. I'm trying to find if there is a way where every time I build my program, it creates a copy of the program in some other directory, kind of like how CHelper in Java creates a final output file in one location. I want this so that I can easily submit my file on codeforces, so I don't have to locate my file every time I solve a new problem.
